item.title: Complete Blue Prince Achievements List
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/complete-blue-prince-achievements-list/

Completing every achievement in Blue Prince, like reaching room 46, will be difficult, even for grizzled puzzle genre veterans.

Blue Prince is far from the traditional puzzle title. Dogubomb’s debut project puts you in the shoes of an heir to Mount Holly Manor and features tabletop card game and roguelike exploration elements. The simple objective is to explore all 45 rooms of the house and discover a secret 46th room, but there is a twist.

Each door opens to one of three rooms, and the choice is yours. The floor plan resets at the end of each in-game day, changing the house layout. It’s up to you to discover tools and permanent upgrades to solve the mystery behind the disappearance of a children’s book author and more secrets along the way. And If there is one thing puzzle fans also love, it’s trophy hunting in games.

How to Complete Every Blue Prince Achievement

Every room in Mount Holly Manor features some puzzle, tool, or blueprint to discover. Yet, what makes Blue Prince so unique is that players don’t need to complete every challenge. Every player will experience their own journey based on the map layout. However, this list of achievements applies to everyone and can be completed by following the steps below.

Check out their names and how to add them to your collection—credit to TrueTrophies.

While we have this list of achievements, Dogubomb has remained tight-lipped on what trophies will be available. Yet, completing every achievement above should put you on track to acquire every trophy.

For more on Blue Prince, check out everything you need to know about whether or not the game will be available on Xbox Game Pass or PlayStation Plus. If you want to know what other highly anticipated games are on the horizon, look at the key details about Marathon and Hades 2.

Which Blue Prince achievement are you going to complete first? If you make a discovery and want to share it, check out the Insider Gaming Forums.

item.title: Minecraft Movie Sequel Already Being Discussed, Says Director
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/minecraft-movie-sequel-already-being-discussed-says-director/

When asked about the sequel in a recent interview, the director of ‘A Minecraft Movie’ stated, “It seems like there’s already talk about it.” 

A Minecraft Movie Director Would Have a ‘Blast’ Making the Sequel  

During an interview with Deadline (via GamesRadar+), Minecraft Movie director Jared Hess was asked how he would deal with a sequel for the biggest-ever opening-day video game movie. Hess stated that the team enjoyed creating this movie; however, the game world is so expansive that “there were so many things” they couldn’t tap into. 

Hess added that he “would have a blast doing the sequel” for the Minecraft movie before stating that he is excited because “it seems like there’s already talk about it happening.” The director added that it would be a lot of fun to dive back into this world, and the audience is also seemingly going ”wild” for their post-credits scene, which hints towards a potential sequel. 

A Minecraft Movie Sequel Will Feature the Newly Teased Character

Hess already has a plan for the characters he will focus on in the sequel. Spoilers Ahead for those who haven’t watched the movie, as this references the post-credits scene.

In the post-credits scene of A Minecraft Movie, they teased Alex, an iconic character from the game’s universe. Hess has stated that “it’s Steve (Black) and Alex, and so that’s the one that we will be bringing to the table without a doubt” for the sequel.

In other news, A Minecraft Movie made $301 million during its opening weekend. Also, Jason Momoa promoted the movie while saying he doesn’t let his kids play video games. What are your thoughts on A Minecraft Movie sequel? Let us know in the comments or on our community forum!

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about Nintendo asking players to buy the Switch 1 if they can’t afford the Switch 2. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.
